item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by C.G. Jung
item.description: "Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes." -- C.G. Jung

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The pendulum of the mind oscillates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Thomas Campbell
item.description: "the soul of conversation is sympathy" -- Thomas Campbell

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "After the bare requisites to living and reproducing, man wants most to leave some record of himself, a proof, perhaps, that he has really existed. He leaves his proof on wood, on stone or on the lives of other people. This deep desire exists in everyone, from the boy who writes dirty words in a public toilet to the Buddha who etches his image in the race mind. Life is so unreal. I think that we seriously doubt that we exist and go about trying to prove that we do." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "Tolle, lege: take up and read." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "Love God, and do what you like." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Dear Jesus, do something." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps the same bird echoed through both of us yesterday, seperate, in the evening." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "A work of art is good if it has arisen out of necessity. That is the only way one can judge it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Embrace your solitude and love it. Endure the pain it causes, and try to sing out with it. For those near to you are distant..." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Things aren't all so tangible and sayable as people would usually have us believe; most experiences are unsayable, they happen in a space that no word has ever entered, and more unsayable than all other things are works of art, those mysterious existences, whose life endures beside our own small, transitory life" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Mme. Bookling add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx
